formatted_address: 1 Fusionopolis Way 02-04/05 Located at the 2nd Floor of connexis Tower Direction from Car Park, Lift Lobby B to 2nd Floor, 1 Fusionopolis Wy, #02-04/05, Singapore 138632
name: Casa Pietrasanta

reviews.text: Simplified fine dining in the west. This place is a pleasant surprise. An almost exclusive dinning restaurant with only 4 tables. This means you get carefully curated menu, food quality and a nice environment to dine & chill in. Reservations highly recommended. Would liked to have taken more photos but it was a business lunch. 3 course meal on a weekday was the best choice. The mushroom soup starter is so exquisite and creamy, a must to try. Kudos to the Chef.
Delicious food and cozy ambience. Chef Carlo and the waiters were very friendly and attentive. Will definitely come back for more!

Had my anniversary dinner with my husband on a Monday night. Small restaurant with a nice homely and cozy feel. Every dish was so fresh, balanced and delicious, it's so hard to pinpoint a favorite! Even the mango sorbet was so good? But the highlight was definitely the pesto gnocchi pasta for me cos it tastes so different from what I was used to. I'll definitely be back again! ‚ù§Ô∏èüòã
Awesome degustation menu ‚ô°‚ô°‚ô° - everything was delicious. Perfect way to start the weekend. Italian hospitality at its finest, cheers üç∑‚ú®Ô∏è

For the price (about 90 per pax after tax), i thought the food was quite mediocre.

Tuna Tartare - the truffle oil didn't quite go with the rest of the dish and the pistachios didn't add anything either.
Zuppa - a bit too tart, but a good amount of seafood.
Pomfret - I felt the sauce was also too tart and a bit too thick.
Beef - this was cooked well
Pistachio ice cream cake - this is just ice cream with  a very thin sponge at the bottom. The ice cream has a nice buttery flavour but the pistachio flavour was weak.
Tiramisu - too much cocoa powder, and the coffee flavour was too strong.

It's quite a small place, but the ambience is ok. Quiet and peaceful.
